snippet: Tissue engineers have succeeded in making artificial organs that use a patient’s cells to become a living part of the body, with hope for eventual organ regeneration.
abstract: Tissue engineers at the Karolinksa Institute in Sweden are building organs by using the body's cells and letting them do most of the work; although the method has produced only relatively simple organs, scientists around the world are using similar techniques with the goal of building more complex organs; some tissue engineers hope to go even further and harness the body's repair mechanisms so that it can remake a damaged organ on its own (Series: Body Builders).
lead_paragraph: Tissue engineers have succeeded in making artificial organs that use a patient’s cells to become a living part of the body, with hope for eventual organ regeneration.

headline.seo: Scientists Make Progress in Tailor-Made Organs
headline.main: A First: Organs Tailor-Made With Body’s Own Cells
headline.print_headline: A First: Organs Tailor-Made With Body’s Own Cells
